clinical_study.brief_title: Endometriosis and Brominated Flame Retardant (ENDOTOX Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Looking for a Link Between Endometriosis and Exposure to Lipophilic Environmental Chemicals Like Brominated Flame Retardant (ENDOTOX Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators wish to highlight, in a Case-Control design, if there is an increased concentration of BFRs in omental adipose tissue of cases ( women with severe endometriosis with surgical indication ) versus bioaccumulation recorded in a control cohort ( women recruited in obstetrics and gynecology or visceral surgery showing no sign of endometriosis ) . Pairing will be operate on Age (+/- 5 years compared to the case ) , BMI ( BMI 5 Classes described by the HAS) and previous breastfeeding experience (yes / no , opposite the release expected bioaccumulate contaminants in breast adipose tissue , when the lactation ) .

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of brominated flame retardant (BFR) in adipose tissue and serum

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of dioxins in adipose tissue and serum
Concentrations of organochlorine pesticides (OCPs) in adipose tissue and serum

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criterion for de cases :
- Age : 18-45 years old
- Deep endometriosis with or without endometriomas that need surgery (clinical examination, MRI, surgery)
- Accessing to the omental and/or parietal adipose tissue
- Non opposition of the patients for the samples collection and consent for the present study.
Inclusion criterion for the controls :
- Patients without any history of endometriosis and without suggestive symptomatology. Often patients operated for cesarean section.
- Possible access to the adipose tissue of the omentum or abdominal wall
Exclusion criterion for the cases :
- Pregnancy
- Death
Exclusion criterion for controls :
- Pregnancy
- Death
